header.h2: A Message from Dr. Lutz Regarding the Coronavirus
A Message from Dr. Lutz (Nepali Translation)

div.p: Dear Baldwin-Whitehall School District Community,

This page is our news center for all information related to the coronavirus (COVID-19). It includes all relevant updates from the District, as well as links to important news, information, and best practices from trusted health organizations.

We will update this page frequently with new information as it becomes available, so please bookmark this page for easy access in the future. If you have questions or concerns, do not hesitate to contact my office or your school office.

Any official decisions regarding public health concerns like the coronavirus are made with the safety and wellbeing of our entire District community in mind. Thank you for doing all you can to keep our District safe and healthy for our children, families, employees, and community members.
Sincerely,
Dr. Randal A. Lutz
Superintendent of the Baldwin-Whitehall School District

div.p: If students/families have any questions during the course of the regular school day, you can use this Google Form to submit a help desk ticket. A district technician will then contact you via email, Google chat, or phone.
Please click on the building's name to access a staff listing with email addresses.

The CHILL Project by Allegheny Health Network provides preventative behavioral health, skill-based learning and application to Baldwin High School. The CHILL Project serves students, faculty, and families to increase overall mindful awareness, resiliency and wellness, while reducing stress, anxiety and depression.
